result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashlee M Waarvik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ashlee M Waarvik is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ashlee M Waarvik was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and DNA surcharge are to be paid at $100 per month commencing 08-01-2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve 15 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashlee M Waarvik

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ashlee M Waarvik in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  
Jury Trial Cancelled.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed outright.
Count 3 is dismissed as read in.


Court orders the following:
Fine:  $694
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $100 per month, starting 08/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  15 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Jury status hearing at 05-17-2016 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person at 05-24-2016 08:30 am.

Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Ashlee M Waarvik in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  
Defense requests a trial date.
  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant Ashlee M Waarvik in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Defendant Ashlee M Waarvik in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:15 am.
with Demand for Trial  filed by Attorney Fay.
